text:
httpd 2.0.52 dyld: httpd version mismatch for library - libexpat 



config.nice contains:

#! /bin/sh
#
# Created by configure

CFLAGS="-I/usr/kerberos/include"; export CFLAGS
"./configure" \
"--with-mpm=prefork" \
"--enable-modules=access alias auth auth_digest dir env include info log_config
mime negotiation rewrite setenvif ssl status usertrack" \
"CFLAGS=-I/usr/kerberos/include" \
"$@"

   './httpd -l'  shows:

dyld: httpd version mismatch for library:
/Users/matisse/devel/abm_enrollment_install/httpd-2.0.52/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib/.libs/libexpat.0.dylib
(compatibility version of user: 6.0.0 greater than library's version: 2.0.0)

Built on Mac OS X 10.3.7
   'uname -a' shows:
   Darwin g5-imac.matisse.net 7.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 7.7.0: Sun Nov  7
16:06:51 PST 2004; root:xnu/xnu-517.9.5.obj~1/RELEASE_PPC  Power Macintosh powerpc



   'locate libexpat' shows:

/sw/lib/libexpat.0.5.0.dylib
/sw/lib/libexpat.0.dylib
/sw/lib/libexpat.a
/sw/lib/libexpat.dylib
/sw/lib/libexpat.la
/sw/var/lib/fink/prebound/deps/sw-lib-libexpat.0.dylib
/sw/var/lib/fink/prebound/deps/sw-lib-libexpat.0.dylib/expat.deplist
/sw/var/lib/fink/prebound/deps/usr-X11R6-lib-libexpat.0.dylib
/sw/var/lib/fink/prebound/deps/usr-X11R6-lib-libexpat.0.dylib/xfree86-shlibs.deplist
/sw/var/lib/fink/prebound/deps/usr-X11R6-lib-libexpat.0.dylib/xfree86.deplist
/usr/X11R6/lib/libexpat.0.4.dylib
/usr/X11R6/lib/libexpat.0.dylib
/usr/X11R6/lib/libexpat.a
/usr/X11R6/lib/libexpat.dylib
creator: matisse@matisse.net

text:
I just tried with httpd-2.0.47 and got the same error:

# ./httpd -l
dyld: httpd version mismatch for library:
/Users/matisse/devel/abm_enrollment_install/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/apr-util/xml/expat/lib/.libs/libexpat.0.dylib
(compatibility version of user: 6.0.0 greater than library's version: 2.0.0)
Trace/BPT trap
creator: matisse@matisse.net

text:
Removing the expat libraries that had been installed via fink, and using
--enable-ssl=static seems to correct or work-around the issue.

I'm going to mark this as INVALID, but if someone else thinks the problem was
something could be avoided in future, perhaps by changes to configure? they can
re-open it.


 That is,

httpd built and runs after doing:

  fink remove expat
  fink remove expat-shlibs

and using a config.nice containing:

#! /bin/sh
#
# Created by configure

"./configure" \
"--prefix=/usr/local/apache2" \
"--enable-rewrite=shared" \
"--enable-auth_digest=shared" \
"--enable-modules=access alias auth dir env include info log_config mime
negotiation setenvif status usertrack" \
"--enable-ssl=static" \
"$@"
creator: matisse@matisse.net
